com.mostlymagic.util.functional.mixin.modify
Interface Adding<T,E>

Type Parameters:
T - Container Type
E - Element Type
All Known Subinterfaces:
Inserting<T,E>, Series<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSeries, ArraySeries, HeadTailSeries
public interface Adding<T,E>

Methods for adding elements.

These methods are loosely equivalent to Collection.add(E) and Collection.addAll(Collection), the main difference being that these methods return a new instance if changes are made.

Author:
Sean Patrick Floyd

Method Summary
 T add(E item)
          Add a new Element and return the resulting container.
 T addArray(E... items)
          Add an array of new Elements and return the resulting container.
 T addCollection(java.util.Collection<E> items)
          Add a Collection of new Elements and return the resulting container.
 T addGathering(Gathering<E> items)
          Add a Gathering of new Elements and return the resulting container.
 

Method Detail

add

T add(E item)
Add a new Element and return the resulting container.

This method will always return a new Object if the contents have changed (if the element is not yet present or duplicates are allowed). However, for Containers that don't allow duplicates this method may return this if the element is already present.

Returns:
the resulting container (usually a new Object)

addArray

T addArray(E... items)
Add an array of new Elements and return the resulting container.

This method will always return a new Object if the contents have changed (if at least one of the elements is not yet present or duplicates are allowed). However, for Containers that don't allow duplicates this method may return this if all elements are already present.

Returns:
the resulting container (usually a new Object)

addCollection

T addCollection(java.util.Collection<E> items)
Add a Collection of new Elements and return the resulting container.

This method will always return a new Object if the contents have changed (if at least one of the elements is not yet present or duplicates are allowed). However, for Containers that don't allow duplicates this method may return this if all elements are already present.

Returns:
the resulting container (usually a new Object)

addGathering

T addGathering(Gathering<E> items)
Add a Gathering of new Elements and return the resulting container.

This method will always return a new Object if the contents have changed (if at least one of the elements is not yet present or duplicates are allowed). However, for Containers that don't allow duplicates this method may return this if all elements are already present.

Returns:
the resulting container (usually a new Object)
